results.title: Pride and prejudice (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Five marriageable daughters! What’s a mother to do? What’s a father to do? What are we to do? Laugh, cry and become totally entranced by “Pride and Prejudice”, Jane Austen’s classic comedy of manners. Adapted for the screen by Aldous Huxley, this energetic film Stars Greer Garson and Laurence Olivier. Also starring are Edmund Gwenn, Mary Boland, Maureen O’Sullivan and Ann Rutherford. The beautiful costumes are by renown designer Adrian.

results.title: Jack the Giant Killer lantern slides
results.brief_description: Magic lantern slides made up of printed coloured images on round pices of glass mounted in a rectangular wood frame with a glue/resin. Frame has printed green label attached on one end noting ‘Patent Enamel Slides for the Magic Lantern, J Barnard & Son, Maker, London, Jack The Giant Killer. #’, the other end of slide has embossed text noting ‘B&S PATENT’.

results.title: Pretty woman (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Steven Reuther, Arnon Milchan, Silver Screen Partners IV and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Garry Marshall “Pretty woman” was the film that helped make a star of American actress Julia Roberts. Originally conceived as a film with a much darker tone, “Pretty woman” is a fairly light-hearted comedy. Edward Lewis, (Richard Gere) a businessman whose speciality is company takeovers, is on assignment in LA when he picks up a prostitute, Viv (Roberts), for the night. In the morning Lewis decides he likes what he sees and decides to hire Viv for a week’s round of polo parties and sex. Despite being somewhat gauche in her dress and manner, Viv is groomed for the part of the society lady, in a Pygmalion like transformation. Challenges ensue for the couple as they take a liking to one another beyond the bounds of their business arrangement. Each is drawn to the possibility that at the week’s end their partnership may blossom into a relationship. Also stars Laura San Giacomo as Viv’s housemate (also a prostitute) and Jason Alexander who plays Lewis’ sleazy lawyer. This special edition version of “Pretty woman” is the director’s cut.

results.title: Pretty Penny
results.creator_credit: Shane Luther, Jacinta Stone and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A light-hearted cautionary tale about human ambitions and moral dilemmas that centres on the relationship between an avaricious coin collector and and a woman who owns a rare coin. Cast: Kestie Morrassi, Shane Luther. (Awards: Sydney Film Festival, 1999; Watch My Shorts Film Festival Melbourne, 1999; Sydney Video & Film Festival, 1999)
